05791                   IfMercOwnedRemoveItemFromMercInv( &( ArmsDealerOfferArea[ uiCnt ]) );
05792 
05793                   //erase the item from the dealer's offer area
05794                   ClearArmsDealerOfferSlot( uiCnt );
05795             }
05796       }
05797       gfResetShopKeepIdleQuote = TRUE;
05798 }
05799 
05800 
05801 
05802 BOOLEAN RemoveRepairItemFromDealersOfferArea( INT8    bSlot )
05803 {
05804       //if the item doesn't have a duplicate copy in its owner merc's inventory slot
05805       if( ArmsDealerOfferArea[ bSlot ].bSlotIdInOtherLocation == -1 )
05806       {
05807             if ( !SKITryToReturnInvToOwnerOrCurrentMerc( &( ArmsDealerOfferArea[ bSlot ] ) ) )
05808             {
05809                   //failed to add item, inventory probably filled up or item is unowned and current merc ineligible
05810                   return( FALSE );
05811             }
05812       }
05813 
05814       // Clear the contents of the dealer's offer slot and its help text
05815       ClearArmsDealerOfferSlot( bSlot );
05816 
05817       // Dirty 
05818       fInterfacePanelDirty = DIRTYLEVEL2;
05819       gubSkiDirtyLevel = SKI_DIRTY_LEVEL1;
05820       return( TRUE );
05821 }
05822 
05823 
05824 INT8  GetInvSlotOfUnfullMoneyInMercInventory( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier )
05825 {
05826       UINT8 ubCnt;
05827 
05828       //loop through the soldier's inventory
05829       for( ubCnt=0; ubCnt < NUM_INV_SLOTS; ubCnt++)
05830       {
05831             // Look for MONEY only, not Gold or Silver!!!  And look for a slot not already full
05832             if( ( pSoldier->inv[ ubCnt ].usItem == MONEY ) && ( pSoldier->inv[ ubCnt ].uiMoneyAmount < MoneySlotLimit( ubCnt ) ) )
05833             {
05834                   return( ubCnt );
05835             }
05836       }
05837       return( - 1 );
05838 }
05839 
05840 
05841 void ClearArmsDealerOfferSlot( INT32 ubSlotToClear )
05842 {
05843       // Clear the contents
05844       memset( &ArmsDealerOfferArea[ ubSlotToClear ], 0, sizeof( INVENTORY_IN_SLOT ) );
05845 
05846       //Remove the mouse help text from the region
05847       SetRegionFastHelpText( &gDealersOfferSlotsMouseRegions[ ubSlotToClear ], L"" );
05848 
05849       //if the dealer repairs
05850       if( ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubTypeOfArmsDealer == ARMS_DEALER_REPAIRS )
05851       {
05852             SetRegionFastHelpText( &gDealersOfferSlotsSmallFaceMouseRegions[ ubSlotToClear ], L"" );
05853       }
05854 }
05855 
05856 
05857 void ClearPlayersOfferSlot( INT32 ubSlotToClear )
05858 {
05859       // Clear the contents
05860       memset( &PlayersOfferArea[ ubSlotToClear ], 0, sizeof( INVENTORY_IN_SLOT ) );
05861 
05862       //Clear the text for the item
05863       SetRegionFastHelpText( &gPlayersOfferSlotsMouseRegions[ ubSlotToClear ], L"" );
05864       SetRegionFastHelpText( &gPlayersOfferSlotsSmallFaceMouseRegions[ ubSlotToClear ], L"" );
05865 
05866       // if the player offer area is clear, reset flags for transaction
05867       CheckAndHandleClearingOfPlayerOfferArea( );
05868 }
05869 
05870 
05871 
05872 void EvaluateItemAddedToPlayersOfferArea( INT8 bSlotID, BOOLEAN fFirstOne )
05873 {
05874       UINT32      uiEvalResult = EVAL_RESULT_NORMAL;
05875       BOOLEAN     fRocketRifleWasEvaluated = FALSE;
05876       UINT8       ubNumberOfItemsAddedToRepairDuringThisEvaluation=0;
05877 
05878 
05879       // there better be an item there
05880       Assert ( PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].fActive );
05881 
05882       //if money is the item being evaluated, leave
05883       if( Item[ PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].sItemIndex ].usItemClass == IC_MONEY )
05884             return;
05885 
05886       // if already evaluated, don't do it again
05887       if( PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].uiFlags & ARMS_INV_PLAYERS_ITEM_HAS_BEEN_EVALUATED )
05888       {
05889             return;
05890       }
05891 
05892 
05893       // say "Hmm... Let's see" once per trading session to start evaluation
05894       // SPECIAL: Devin doesn't have this quote (he's the only one)
05895       if( !gfDealerHasSaidTheEvaluateQuoteOnceThisSession && ( gbSelectedArmsDealerID != ARMS_DEALER_DEVIN ) )
05896       {
05897             gfDealerHasSaidTheEvaluateQuoteOnceThisSession = TRUE;
05898             StartShopKeeperTalking( SK_QUOTES_PLAYER_REQUESTED_EVALUATION );
05899       }
05900 
05901 
05902       //Can this particular kind of item be sold/repaired here
05903       if( WillShopKeeperRejectObjectsFromPlayer( gbSelectedArmsDealerID, bSlotID ) == FALSE )
05904       {
05905             //if the dealer repairs
05906             if( ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubTypeOfArmsDealer == ARMS_DEALER_REPAIRS )
05907             {
05908                   UINT32      uiNumberOfItemsInForRepairs = CountTotalItemsRepairDealerHasInForRepairs( gbSelectedArmsDealerID );
05909                   UINT32      uiNumberOfItemsAlreadyEvaluated = CountNumberOfItemsInTheArmsDealersOfferArea();
05910 
05911                   //Get the number of items being evaluated
05912                   ubNumberOfItemsAddedToRepairDuringThisEvaluation = PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].ItemObject.ubNumberOfObjects;
05913 
05914                   //if there is already enough items in for repairs, complain about it and DON'T accept the item for repairs
05915                   if( ( uiNumberOfItemsAlreadyEvaluated + ubNumberOfItemsAddedToRepairDuringThisEvaluation + uiNumberOfItemsInForRepairs ) > SKI_MAX_AMOUNT_OF_ITEMS_DEALER_CAN_REPAIR_AT_A_TIME )
05916                   {
05917                         if ( !gfAlreadySaidTooMuchToRepair )
05918                         {
05919                               //Start the dealer talking
05920                               StartShopKeeperTalking( SK_QUOTES_CANT_AFFORD_TO_BUY_OR_TOO_MUCH_TO_REPAIR );
05921                               gfAlreadySaidTooMuchToRepair = TRUE;
05922                         }
05923                         return;
05924                   }
05925 
05926                   //if the item is a rocket rifle
05927                   if( ItemIsARocketRifle( PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].sItemIndex ) )
05928                   {
05929                         fRocketRifleWasEvaluated = TRUE;
05930                   }
05931 
05932 
05933                   //if the item is damaged, or is a rocket rifle (which always "need repairing" even at 100%, to reset imprinting)
05934                   if( ( PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].ItemObject.bStatus[ 0 ] < 100 ) || fRocketRifleWasEvaluated )
05935                   {
05936                         INT8  bSlotAddedTo;
05937 
05938                         // Move the item to the Dealer's Offer Area
05939                         bSlotAddedTo = AddItemToArmsDealerOfferArea( &PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ], PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].bSlotIdInOtherLocation );
05940 
05941                         if( bSlotAddedTo != -1 )
05942                         {
05943                               // Clear the contents
05944                               ClearPlayersOfferSlot( bSlotID );
05945 
05946 /*    ARM: Leave it there, until transaction occurs it should be recallable
05947                               //Remove the item from the owner merc's inventory
05948                               IfMercOwnedRemoveItemFromMercInv( &(ArmsDealerOfferArea[ bSlotAddedTo ]) );
05949 */
05950 
05951                               //Mark the item as unselected, signifying that it can be moved
05952                               ArmsDealerOfferArea[ bSlotAddedTo ].uiFlags &= ~ARMS_INV_ITEM_SELECTED;
05953 
05954                               //increment the number of items being added
05955                               ubNumberOfItemsAddedToRepairDuringThisEvaluation++;
05956 
05957                               // check if the item is really badly damaged
05958                               if( Item[ ArmsDealerOfferArea[ bSlotAddedTo ].sItemIndex ].usItemClass != IC_AMMO )
05959                               {
05960                                     if( ArmsDealerOfferArea[ bSlotAddedTo ].ItemObject.bStatus[ 0 ] < REALLY_BADLY_DAMAGED_THRESHOLD )
05961                                     {
05962                                           uiEvalResult = EVAL_RESULT_OK_BUT_REALLY_DAMAGED;
05963                                     }
05964                               }
05965 
05966                               // check if it's the first time a rocket rifle is being submitted to Fredo
05967                               if( fRocketRifleWasEvaluated && ( gbSelectedArmsDealerID == ARMS_DEALER_FREDO ) )
05968                               {
05969                                     //if he hasn't yet said his quote
05970                                     if( !( gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubSpecificDealerFlags & ARMS_DEALER_FLAG__FREDO_HAS_SAID_ROCKET_RIFLE_QUOTE ) )
05971                                     {
05972                                           // use this special evaluation result instead (has a unique quote)
05973                                           uiEvalResult = EVAL_RESULT_ROCKET_RIFLE;
05974                                     }
05975                               }
05976                         }
05977                         else
05978                         {
05979                               #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
05980                                     ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_WHITE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"Failed to add repair item to ArmsDealerOfferArea.  AM-0");
05981                               #endif
05982                               return;
05983                         }
05984                   }
05985                   else
05986                   {
05987                         uiEvalResult = EVAL_RESULT_NOT_DAMAGED;
05988                   }
05989             }
05990             else  // not a repairman
05991             {
05992                   uiEvalResult = EvaluateInvSlot( & ( PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ] ) );
05993             }
05994       }
05995       else  // dealer doesn't handle this type of object
05996       {
05997             if( ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubTypeOfArmsDealer == ARMS_DEALER_REPAIRS )
05998             {
05999                   // only otherwise repairable items count as actual rejections
06000 //                if ( Item[ PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].sItemIndex ].fFlags & ITEM_REPAIRABLE )
06001                   if ( Item[ PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].sItemIndex ].repairable  )
06002                   {
06003                         uiEvalResult = EVAL_RESULT_DONT_HANDLE;
06004                   }
06005                   else
06006                   {
06007                         uiEvalResult = EVAL_RESULT_NON_REPAIRABLE;
06008                   }
06009             }
06010             else
06011             {
06012                   uiEvalResult = EVAL_RESULT_DONT_HANDLE;
06013             }
06014       }
06015 
06016 
06017       // mark this item as having been evaluated
06018       PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotID ].uiFlags |= ARMS_INV_PLAYERS_ITEM_HAS_BEEN_EVALUATED;
06019 
06020 
06021       // when evaluating complex items that get split into multiple subobjects, dealer will talk only about the first one!
06022       // don't bother with any of this if shopkeeper can't talk right now
06023       if ( fFirstOne && CanShopkeeperOverrideDialogue( ) )
06024       {
06025             INT16 sQuoteNum = -1;
06026             UINT8 ubChanceToSayNormalQuote;
06027 
06028 
06029             switch ( uiEvalResult )
06030             {
06031                   case EVAL_RESULT_DONT_HANDLE:
06032                         if( ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubTypeOfArmsDealer == ARMS_DEALER_SELLS_ONLY )
06033                         {
06034                               // then he doesn't have quotes 17, 19, or 20, always use 4.  Devin doesn't have 18 either,
06035                               // while the text of 18 seems wrong for Sam & Howard if offered something they should consider valuable.
06036                               sQuoteNum = SK_QUOTES_NOT_INTERESTED_IN_THIS_ITEM;                
06037                         }
06038                         else
06039                         {
06040                               // he accepts items, but not this one
06041                               sQuoteNum = SK_QUOTES_DURING_EVALUATION_STUFF_REJECTED;                 
06042                         }
06043                         break;
06044 
06045                   case EVAL_RESULT_NON_REPAIRABLE:
06046                         // use quote 4 for this situation...  It's a bit weird but better than "that looks fine / ain't broke"
06047                         sQuoteNum = SK_QUOTES_NOT_INTERESTED_IN_THIS_ITEM;
06048                         break;
06049 
06050                   case EVAL_RESULT_NOT_DAMAGED:
06051                   case EVAL_RESULT_WORTHLESS:
06052                         sQuoteNum = SK_QUOTES_EVALUATION_RESULT_VALUE_OF_ZERO;
06053                         break;
06054 
06055                   case EVAL_RESULT_OK_BUT_REALLY_DAMAGED:
06056                         sQuoteNum = SK_QUOTES_EVALUATION_RESULT_SOME_REALLY_DAMAGED_ITEMS;
06057                         break;
06058 
06059                   case EVAL_RESULT_ROCKET_RIFLE:
06060                         sQuoteNum = FREDO_QUOTE_CAN_RESET_IMPRINTING;
06061                         break;
06062 
06063                   case EVAL_RESULT_NORMAL:
06064                         //if it has been a long time since saying the last quote
06065                         if( guiLastTimeDealerSaidNormalEvaluationQuote == 0 )
06066                               ubChanceToSayNormalQuote = 100;
06067                         else if( ( GetJA2Clock() - guiLastTimeDealerSaidNormalEvaluationQuote ) > 25000 )
06068                               ubChanceToSayNormalQuote = 60;
06069                         else if( ( GetJA2Clock() - guiLastTimeDealerSaidNormalEvaluationQuote ) > 12000 )
06070                               ubChanceToSayNormalQuote = 25;
06071                         else if( ( GetJA2Clock() - guiLastTimeDealerSaidNormalEvaluationQuote ) > 7000 )
06072                               ubChanceToSayNormalQuote = 10;
06073                         else
06074                               ubChanceToSayNormalQuote = 0;
06075 
06076                         if( Chance( ubChanceToSayNormalQuote ) )
06077                         {
06078                               sQuoteNum = SK_QUOTES_EVALUATION_RESULT_NORMAL;
06079                         }
06080                         break;
06081             
06082                   default:
06083                         #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
06084                               ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_WHITE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"Invalid evaluation result of %d.  AM-0", uiEvalResult );
06085                         #endif
06086                         break;
06087             }
06088 
06089             // if a valid quote was selected
06090             if ( sQuoteNum != -1 )
06091             {
06092                   // if the appropriate quote hasn't already been used during this evaluation cycle
06093                   if ( !gfEvalResultQuoteSaid[ uiEvalResult ] )
06094                   {
06095                         // try to say it
06096                         if ( StartShopKeeperTalking( ( UINT16 ) sQuoteNum ) )
06097                         {
06098                               // set flag to keep from repeating it
06099                               gfEvalResultQuoteSaid[ uiEvalResult ] = TRUE;
06100 
06101                               // if it's the normal result
06102                               if ( uiEvalResult == EVAL_RESULT_NORMAL )
06103                               {
06104                                     // set new time of last usage
06105                                     guiLastTimeDealerSaidNormalEvaluationQuote = GetJA2Clock();
06106                               }
06107 
06108                               if ( sQuoteNum == FREDO_QUOTE_CAN_RESET_IMPRINTING )
06109                               {
06110                                     //Set the fact that we have said this (to prevent that quote from coming up again)
06111                                     gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubSpecificDealerFlags |= ARMS_DEALER_FLAG__FREDO_HAS_SAID_ROCKET_RIFLE_QUOTE;
06112                               }
06113                         }
06114                   }
06115             }
06116       }
06117 }
06118 
06119 
06120 BOOLEAN DoSkiMessageBox( UINT8 ubStyle, STR16 zString, UINT32 uiExitScreen, UINT8 ubFlags, MSGBOX_CALLBACK ReturnCallback )
06121 {
06122       SGPRect pCenteringRect= {0, 0, SCREEN_WIDTH - 1, SCREEN_HEIGHT - INV_INTERFACE_HEIGHT };
06123 
06124       // reset exit mode
06125       gfExitSKIDueToMessageBox = TRUE;
06126 
06127       // do message box and return
06128       giSKIMessageBox = DoMessageBox( ubStyle, zString, uiExitScreen, ( UINT8 ) ( ubFlags| MSG_BOX_FLAG_USE_CENTERING_RECT ), ReturnCallback, &pCenteringRect );
06129 
06130       // send back return state
06131       return( ( giSKIMessageBox != -1 ) );
06132 }
06133 
06134 void ConfirmDontHaveEnoughForTheDealerMessageBoxCallBack( UINT8 bExitValue )
06135 {
06136       // simply redraw the panel
06137       if( bExitValue == MSG_BOX_RETURN_OK )
06138       {
06139             gubSkiDirtyLevel = SKI_DIRTY_LEVEL2;
06140       }
06141 
06142       // done, re-enable calls to PerformTransaction()
06143       gfPerformTransactionInProgress = FALSE;
06144 
06145       return;
06146 }
06147 
06148 
06149 
06150 void ConfirmToDeductMoneyFromPlayersAccountMessageBoxCallBack( UINT8 bExitValue )
06151 {
06152       // yes, deduct the money
06153       if( bExitValue == MSG_BOX_RETURN_YES )
06154       {
06155             UINT32      uiPlayersOfferAreaValue = CalculateTotalPlayersValue();
06156             UINT32      uiArmsDealersItemsCost = CalculateTotalArmsDealerCost();
06157             INT32       iMoneyToDeduct = (INT32)( uiArmsDealersItemsCost - uiPlayersOfferAreaValue );
06158 
06159             //Perform the transaction with the extra money from the players account
06160             PerformTransaction( iMoneyToDeduct );
06161 
06162             AddTransactionToPlayersBook( PURCHASED_ITEM_FROM_DEALER, ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubShopKeeperID, GetWorldTotalMin(), -iMoneyToDeduct );
06163       }
06164 
06165       // done, re-enable calls to PerformTransaction()
06166       gfPerformTransactionInProgress = FALSE;
06167 
06168       gubSkiDirtyLevel = SKI_DIRTY_LEVEL2;
06169 }
06170 
06171 
06172 
06173 // run through what the player has on the table and see if the shop keep will aceept it or not
06174 BOOLEAN WillShopKeeperRejectObjectsFromPlayer( INT8 bDealerId, INT8 bSlotId )
06175 {
06176       BOOLEAN fRejected = TRUE;
06177 
06178       if( Item[ PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotId ].sItemIndex ].usItemClass == IC_MONEY )
06179       {
06180             fRejected = FALSE;
06181       }
06182       else if( CanDealerTransactItem( gbSelectedArmsDealerID, PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotId ].sItemIndex, TRUE ) )
06183       {
06184             fRejected = FALSE;
06185       }
06186 
06187       else
06188       {
06189             fRejected = TRUE;
06190       }
06191 
06192       return( fRejected );
06193 }
06194 
06195 
06196 void CheckAndHandleClearingOfPlayerOfferArea( void )
06197 {
06198       INT32 iCounter = 0;
06199       BOOLEAN fActiveSlot = FALSE;
06200 
06201       // find out if all the player trade slots/offer area is empty
06202       for( iCounter=0; iCounter<SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS; iCounter++)
06203       {
06204             if( PlayersOfferArea[ iCounter ].fActive == TRUE )
06205             {
06206                   // nope, there is an active slot
06207                   fActiveSlot = TRUE;
06208             }
06209       }
06210 
06211       // if all player's offer area slots are empty
06212       if( fActiveSlot == FALSE )
06213       {
06214             ResetAllQuoteSaidFlags();
06215             gfRemindedPlayerToPickUpHisStuff = FALSE;
06216       }
06217 
06218       return;
06219 }
06220 
06221 
06222 BOOLEAN CanShopkeeperOverrideDialogue( void )
06223 {
06224       // if he's not currently saying anything
06225       if( !gfIsTheShopKeeperTalking && ( giShopKeepDialogueEventinProgress == -1 ) )
06226       {
06227             return( TRUE );
06228       }
06229 
06230       // if the quote he is currently saying is unimportant (fluff),
06231       // then shut him up & allow the override
06232       if( giShopKeepDialogueEventinProgress < SK_QUOTES_PLAYER_REQUESTED_EVALUATION )
06233       {
06234             // shutup the shop keep and do this quote
06235             ShutUpShopKeeper( );
06236             return( TRUE );
06237       }
06238 
06239       // he's currently saying something important
06240       return( FALSE );
06241 }
06242 
06243 
06244 void CrossOutUnwantedItems( void )
06245 {
06246       HVOBJECT hHandle;
06247       INT8 bSlotId = 0;
06248       INT16 sBoxStartX = 0, sBoxStartY = 0;
06249       INT16 sBoxWidth = 0, sBoxHeight = 0;
06250       
06251 
06252       // load the "cross out" graphic
06253       GetVideoObject( &hHandle, guiItemCrossOut );
06254 
06255       // get the box height and width
06256       sBoxWidth = SKI_INV_SLOT_WIDTH;
06257       sBoxHeight = SKI_INV_SLOT_HEIGHT;
06258 
06259       for( bSlotId = 0; bSlotId < SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS; bSlotId++ )
06260       {
06261             // now run through what's on the players offer area
06262             if( PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotId ].fActive )
06263             {
06264                   // skip purchased items!
06265                   if ( !( PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotId ].uiFlags & ARMS_INV_JUST_PURCHASED ) )
06266                   {
06267                         //If item can't be sold here, or it's completely worthless (very cheap / very broken)
06268                         if( ( WillShopKeeperRejectObjectsFromPlayer( gbSelectedArmsDealerID, bSlotId ) == TRUE ) ||
06269                                     !( PlayersOfferArea[ bSlotId ].uiFlags & ARMS_INV_PLAYERS_ITEM_HAS_VALUE ) )
06270                         {
06271                               // get x and y positions
06272                               sBoxStartX = SKI_PLAYERS_TRADING_INV_X + ( bSlotId % SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_COLS ) * ( SKI_INV_OFFSET_X );
06273                               sBoxStartY = SKI_PLAYERS_TRADING_INV_Y + ( bSlotId / SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_COLS ) * ( SKI_INV_OFFSET_Y );
06274 
06275                               BltVideoObject(FRAME_BUFFER, hHandle, 0,( sBoxStartX + 22 ), ( sBoxStartY ), VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY,NULL);
06276 
06277                               // invalidate the region
06278                               InvalidateRegion(sBoxStartX - 1, sBoxStartY - 1, sBoxStartX + sBoxWidth + 1, sBoxStartY + sBoxHeight + 1 );
06279                         }
06280                   }
06281             }
06282       }
06283 
06284       return;
06285 }
06286 
06287 
06288 INT16 GetNumberOfItemsInPlayerOfferArea( void )
06289 {
06290       INT16 sCounter = 0;
06291       INT32 iCounter = 0;
06292 
06293 
06294       // find number of active slot in player offer area
06295       for( iCounter = 0; iCounter < SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS; iCounter++ )
06296       {
06297             if( PlayersOfferArea[ iCounter ].fActive )
06298             {
06299                   sCounter++;
06300             }
06301       }
06302 
06303       return( sCounter );
06304 }
06305 
06306 void HandleCheckIfEnoughOnTheTable( void )
06307 {
06308       static INT32 iLastTime = 0;
06309       INT32 iTime = 0, iDifference = 0, iRand = 0;
06310       UINT32      uiPlayersOfferAreaValue = CalculateTotalPlayersValue();
06311       UINT32      uiArmsDealersItemsCost = CalculateTotalArmsDealerCost();
06312 
06313       if( ( iLastTime == 0 ) || gfResetShopKeepIdleQuote )
06314       {
06315             iLastTime = GetJA2Clock();
06316             gfResetShopKeepIdleQuote = FALSE;
06317       }
06318 
06319       iDifference = GetJA2Clock() - iLastTime;
06320 
06321       iRand = Random( 100 );
06322 
06323       // delay for shopkeeper passed?
06324       if( iDifference > DELAY_FOR_SHOPKEEPER_IDLE_QUOTE )
06325       {
06326             // random chance enough?
06327             if( iRand > CHANCE_FOR_SHOPKEEPER_IDLE_QUOTE )
06328             {
06329                   // is there enough on the table
06330                   if( ( uiArmsDealersItemsCost > uiPlayersOfferAreaValue ) && ( uiPlayersOfferAreaValue ) )
06331                   {
06332                         StartShopKeeperTalking( SK_QUOTES_EVAULATION_PLAYER_DOESNT_HAVE_ENOUGH_VALUE );
06333                   }
06334             }
06335 
06336             gfResetShopKeepIdleQuote = TRUE;
06337       }
06338 
06339       return;
06340 }
06341 
06342 
06343 
06344 void InitShopKeeperItemDescBox( OBJECTTYPE *pObject, UINT8 ubPocket, UINT8 ubFromLocation )
06345 {
06346       INT16 sPosX, sPosY;
06347 
06348 
06349       switch( ubFromLocation )
06350       {
06351             case ARMS_DEALER_INVENTORY:
06352             {
06353                   UINT8 ubSelectedInvSlot = ubPocket - gSelectArmsDealerInfo.ubFirstItemIndexOnPage;
06354 
06355                   sPosX = SKI_ARMS_DEALERS_INV_START_X + ( SKI_INV_OFFSET_X * ( ubSelectedInvSlot % SKI_NUM_ARMS_DEALERS_INV_COLS ) - ( 358 / 2 ) ) + SKI_INV_SLOT_WIDTH / 2;
06356 
06357                   sPosY = SKI_ARMS_DEALERS_INV_START_Y + ( ( SKI_INV_OFFSET_Y * ubSelectedInvSlot / SKI_NUM_ARMS_DEALERS_INV_COLS ) + 1 ) - ( 128 / 2 ) + SKI_INV_SLOT_HEIGHT / 2;
06358 
06359                   // WANNE 2
06360                   //if the start position + the height of the box is off the screen, reposition
06361                   if( sPosY < (0 + SCREEN_Y_OFFSET) )
06362                         sPosY = 0 + SCREEN_Y_OFFSET;
06363 
06364 
06365                   //if the start position + the width of the box is off the screen, reposition
06366                   if( ( sPosX + 358 ) > SCREEN_WIDTH )
06367                         sPosX = sPosX - ( ( sPosX + 358 ) - SCREEN_WIDTH ) - 5;
06368 
06369                   //if it is starting to far to the left
06370                   else if( sPosX < (0 + SCREEN_X_OFFSET) )
06371                         sPosX = 0 + SCREEN_X_OFFSET;
06372 
06373                   //if the box will appear over the mercs face, move the box over so it doesn't obstruct the face
06374                   if( sPosY < SKI_FACE_Y + SKI_FACE_HEIGHT + 20 )
06375                         if( sPosX < (SCREEN_X_OFFSET + 160) )
06376                               sPosX = SCREEN_X_OFFSET + 160;
06377 
06378             }
06379             break;
06380 
06381             case ARMS_DEALER_OFFER_AREA:
06382             {
06383                   sPosX = SKI_ARMS_DEALERS_TRADING_INV_X + ( SKI_INV_OFFSET_X * ( ubPocket % ( SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS/2) ) - ( 358 / 2 ) ) + SKI_INV_SLOT_WIDTH / 2;
06384 
06385                   sPosY = SKI_ARMS_DEALERS_TRADING_INV_Y + ( ( SKI_INV_OFFSET_Y * ubPocket / ( SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS/2) ) + 1 ) - ( 128 / 2 ) + SKI_INV_SLOT_HEIGHT / 2;
06386 
06387                   //if the start position + the height of the box is off the screen, reposition
06388                   if( sPosY < (SCREEN_Y_OFFSET + 0) )
06389                         sPosY = 0 + SCREEN_Y_OFFSET;
06390 
06391 
06392                   //if the start position + the width of the box is off the screen, reposition
06393                   if( ( sPosX + 358 ) > SCREEN_WIDTH )
06394                         sPosX = sPosX - ( ( sPosX + 358 ) - SCREEN_WIDTH ) - 5;
06395 
06396                   //if it is starting to far to the left
06397                   else if( sPosX < (0 + SCREEN_X_OFFSET) )
06398                         sPosX = 10 + SCREEN_X_OFFSET;
06399 
06400                   //if the box will appear over the mercs face, move the box over so it doesn't obstruct the face
06401                   if( sPosY < SKI_FACE_Y + SKI_FACE_HEIGHT + 20 )
06402                         if( sPosX < (160 + SCREEN_X_OFFSET) )
06403                               sPosY = SCREEN_Y_OFFSET + INV_INTERFACE_HEIGHT;
06404             }
06405             break;
06406 
06407             default:
06408                   Assert( 0 );
06409                   return;
06410       }
06411 
06412 
06413       pShopKeeperItemDescObject = pObject;
06414 
06415       InitItemDescriptionBox( gpSMCurrentMerc, 255, sPosX, sPosY, 0 );
06416 
06417       StartSKIDescriptionBox( );
06418 }
06419 
06420 
06421 void StartSKIDescriptionBox( void )
06422 {
06423       INT32 iCnt;
06424 
06425       //shadow the entire screen
06426 //    ShadowVideoSurfaceRect( FRAME_BUFFER, 0, 0, 640, 480 );
06427 
06428       //if the current merc is too far away, dont shade the SM panel because it is already shaded
06429       
06430       // WANNE 2: Do not shade the background
06431       if( gfSMDisableForItems )
06432             DrawHatchOnInventory( FRAME_BUFFER, SCREEN_X_OFFSET, SCREEN_Y_OFFSET, SKI_INTERFACE_WIDTH, SKI_INTERFACE_HEIGHT );
06433       else
06434       {
06435             DrawHatchOnInventory( FRAME_BUFFER, SCREEN_X_OFFSET, SCREEN_Y_OFFSET, SKI_INTERFACE_WIDTH, SKI_INTERFACE_HEIGHT );
06436       }
06437 
06438       InvalidateRegion( 0, 0, SCREEN_WIDTH, SCREEN_HEIGHT );
06439 
06440       // disable almost everything!
06441 
06442       gfSMDisableForItems = TRUE;
06443       DisableInvRegions( gfSMDisableForItems );
06444 
06445       DisableButton( guiSKI_InvPageUpButton );
06446       DisableButton( guiSKI_InvPageDownButton );
06447 //    DisableButton( guiSKI_EvaluateButton );
06448       DisableButton( guiSKI_TransactionButton );
06449       DisableButton( guiSKI_DoneButton );
06450 /*
06451       for (iCnt = 0; iCnt < NUM_SKI_ATM_BUTTONS; iCnt++)
06452             DisableButton( guiSKI_AtmButton[ iCnt ] );
06453 */
06454 
06455       DisableAllDealersInventorySlots();
06456       DisableAllDealersOfferSlots();
06457 
06458       for (iCnt = 0; iCnt < SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS; iCnt++)
06459       {
06460             MSYS_DisableRegion( &gPlayersOfferSlotsMouseRegions[ iCnt ] );
06461             MSYS_DisableRegion( &gPlayersOfferSlotsSmallFaceMouseRegions[ iCnt ] );
06462       }
06463 
06464       if( gShopKeeperSubTitleMouseRegion.uiFlags & MSYS_REGION_EXISTS )
06465       {
06466             MSYS_DisableRegion( &gShopKeeperSubTitleMouseRegion );
06467       }
06468 
06469 //    MSYS_DisableRegion( &gShopKeeperCoverTacticalButtonMouseRegion );
06470 
06471 //    if( giItemDescAmmoButton >= 0 && ButtonList[ giItemDescAmmoButton ].
06472 //    DisableButton( giItemDescAmmoButton );
06473 
06474 
06475       RenderItemDescriptionBox( );
06476 }
06477 
06478 
06479 void DeleteShopKeeperItemDescBox()
06480 {
06481       INT32 iCnt;
06482 
06483 
06484       pShopKeeperItemDescObject = NULL;
06485       gubSkiDirtyLevel = SKI_DIRTY_LEVEL2;
06486 
06487       //Redraw the face 
06488       gFacesData[ giShopKeeperFaceIndex ].uiFlags |= FACE_REDRAW_WHOLE_FACE_NEXT_FRAME;
06489 
06490 
06491       // enable almost everything!
06492 
06493       CheckForDisabledForGiveItem( );
06494       DisableInvRegions( gfSMDisableForItems ); //actually does an enable if current merc is in range
06495 
06496       EnableButton( guiSKI_InvPageUpButton );
06497       EnableButton( guiSKI_InvPageDownButton );
06498       EnableButton( guiSKI_TransactionButton );
06499       EnableButton( guiSKI_DoneButton );
06500 
06501       EnableDisableDealersInventoryPageButtons();
06502       EnableDisableEvaluateAndTransactionButtons();
06503 
06504 //    EnableButton( guiSKI_EvaluateButton );
06505 
06506 /*
06507       for (iCnt = 0; iCnt < NUM_SKI_ATM_BUTTONS; iCnt++)
06508             EnableButton( guiSKI_AtmButton[ iCnt ] );
06509 */
06510 
06511       EnableAllDealersInventorySlots();
06512       EnableAllDealersOfferSlots();
06513 
06514       for (iCnt = 0; iCnt < SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS; iCnt++)
06515       {
06516             MSYS_EnableRegion( &gPlayersOfferSlotsMouseRegions[ iCnt ] );
06517             MSYS_EnableRegion( &gPlayersOfferSlotsSmallFaceMouseRegions[ iCnt ] );
06518       }
06519 
06520       if( gShopKeeperSubTitleMouseRegion.uiFlags & MSYS_REGION_EXISTS )
06521       {
06522             MSYS_EnableRegion( &gShopKeeperSubTitleMouseRegion );
06523       }
06524 
06525 //    MSYS_EnableRegion( &gShopKeeperCoverTacticalButtonMouseRegion );
06526 
06527 //    if( giItemDescAmmoButton >= 0 && ButtonList[ giItemDescAmmoButton ].
06528 //    EnableButton( giItemDescAmmoButton );
06529 
06530 }
06531 
06532 
06533 
06534 BOOLEAN OfferObjectToDealer( OBJECTTYPE *pComplexObject, UINT8 ubOwnerProfileId, INT8 bOwnerSlotId )
06535 {
06536       UINT8       ubTotalSubObjects;
06537       UINT8       ubRepairableSubObjects;
06538       UINT8       ubNonRepairableSubObjects;
06539       UINT8       ubDealerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded;
06540       UINT8       ubPlayerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded;
06541       UINT8       ubDiff;
06542       UINT8       ubHowManyMoreItemsCanDealerTake;
06543       UINT8       ubSubObject;
06544       BOOLEAN     fFirstOne = TRUE;
06545       BOOLEAN fSuccess = FALSE; 
06546 
06547 
06548       if ( ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubTypeOfArmsDealer != ARMS_DEALER_REPAIRS )
06549       {
06550             // if not actually doing repairs, there's no need to split objects up at all
06551             if ( !AddObjectForEvaluation( pComplexObject, ubOwnerProfileId, bOwnerSlotId, TRUE ) )
06552             {
06553                   gfDisplayNoRoomMsg = TRUE;
06554                   return(FALSE);    // no room
06555             }
06556       }
06557       else  // dealing with a repairman
06558       {
06559             // split the object into its components
06560             SplitComplexObjectIntoSubObjects( pComplexObject );
06561 
06562             // determine how many subobjects of each category this complex object will have to be broken up into
06563             CountSubObjectsInObject( pComplexObject, &ubTotalSubObjects, &ubRepairableSubObjects, &ubNonRepairableSubObjects );
06564 
06565             // in the simplest situation, the # subobjects of each type gives us how many slots of each type are needed
06566             ubDealerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded = ubRepairableSubObjects;
06567             ubPlayerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded = ubNonRepairableSubObjects;
06568 
06569             // consider that if dealer is at or will reach his max # of items repaired limit, not everything repairable will move
06570             ubHowManyMoreItemsCanDealerTake = SKI_MAX_AMOUNT_OF_ITEMS_DEALER_CAN_REPAIR_AT_A_TIME -
06571                                                                                                                   CountTotalItemsRepairDealerHasInForRepairs( gbSelectedArmsDealerID ) -
06572                                                                                                                   CountNumberOfItemsInTheArmsDealersOfferArea();
06573 
06574             // if he can't repair everything repairable that we're about to submit, the space we'll need changes
06575             if ( ubDealerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded > ubHowManyMoreItemsCanDealerTake )
06576             {
06577                   ubDiff = ubDealerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded - ubHowManyMoreItemsCanDealerTake;
06578                   ubDealerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded -= ubDiff;
06579                   ubPlayerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded += ubDiff;
06580             }
06581 
06582             // if there is anything repairable that dealer will accept
06583             if ( ubDealerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded > 0 )
06584             {
06585                   // we need at least one EXTRA empty slot in player's area to pass repairable objects through for their evaluation
06586                   ubPlayerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded++;
06587             }
06588 
06589             Assert( SKI_MAX_AMOUNT_OF_ITEMS_DEALER_CAN_REPAIR_AT_A_TIME < SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS );
06590 /*
06591             This code is commented out because a repair dealer will never be allowed to repair over more then
06592             SKI_MAX_AMOUNT_OF_ITEMS_DEALER_CAN_REPAIR_AT_A_TIME ( 4 ) items at a time, therefore, cant fill up the dealer offer area
06593 
06594             // check if we have room for all of each type
06595             if ( ( ubDealerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded + CountNumberOfItemsInTheArmsDealersOfferArea() ) > SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS )
06596             {
06597                   // tell player there's not enough room in the dealer's offer area
06598                   DoSkiMessageBox( MSG_BOX_BASIC_STYLE, L"There is not enough room in the dealers repair area.", SHOPKEEPER_SCREEN, MSG_BOX_FLAG_OK, NULL );
06599                   return(FALSE);    // no room
06600             }
06601 */
06602 
06603             if ( ( ubPlayerOfferAreaSlotsNeeded + CountNumberOfItemsInThePlayersOfferArea( ) ) > SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS )
06604             {
06605                   gfDisplayNoRoomMsg = TRUE;
06606                   return(FALSE);    // no room
06607             }
06608 
06609             // we have room, so move them all to the appropriate slots
06610             for ( ubSubObject = 0; ubSubObject < MAX_SUBOBJECTS_PER_OBJECT; ubSubObject++ )
06611             {
06612                   // if there is something stored there
06613                   if ( gSubObject[ ubSubObject ].usItem != NONE )
06614                   {
06615                         // if it's the main item itself (always in the very first subobject), and it has no other subobjects
06616                         if ( ( ubSubObject == 0 ) && ( ubTotalSubObjects == 1) )
06617                         {
06618                               // store its owner merc as the owner, and store the correct slot
06619                               fSuccess = AddObjectForEvaluation( &gSubObject[ ubSubObject ], ubOwnerProfileId, bOwnerSlotId, fFirstOne );
06620                         }
06621                         else  // attachments, bullets/payload
06622                         {
06623                               // store it with a valid owner, but an invalid slot, so it still shows who owns it, but can't return to its slot
06624 // ARM: New code will be needed here if we add parent/child item support & interface
06625                               fSuccess = AddObjectForEvaluation( &gSubObject[ ubSubObject ], ubOwnerProfileId, -1, fFirstOne );
06626                         }
06627 
06628                         // it has to succeed, or we have a bug in our earlier check for sufficient room
06629                         Assert( fSuccess );
06630 
06631                         fFirstOne = FALSE;
06632                   }
06633             }
06634 
06635             gfAlreadySaidTooMuchToRepair = FALSE;
06636       }
06637 
06638 //ARM: This comment isn't true unless parent/child support is added.  Right now repairmen don't do this!
06639       // NOTE that, either way, if owned, the item remains in the merc's inventory (hatched out) until the transaction is completed
06640 
06641       // Dirty 
06642       fInterfacePanelDirty = DIRTYLEVEL2;
06643 
06644       return(TRUE);           // it worked
06645 }
06646 
06647 
06648 
06649 void SplitComplexObjectIntoSubObjects( OBJECTTYPE *pComplexObject )
06650 {
06651       OBJECTTYPE *pNextObj = &gSubObject[ 0 ];
06652       UINT8 ubNextFreeSlot = 0;
06653       UINT8 ubCnt;
06654 
06655 
06656       Assert( pComplexObject );
06657       Assert( pComplexObject->ubNumberOfObjects > 0 );
06658       Assert( pComplexObject->ubNumberOfObjects <= MAX_OBJECTS_PER_SLOT );
06659 
06660 
06661       // clear subobject array
06662       memset (gSubObject, 0, sizeof( OBJECTTYPE ) * MAX_SUBOBJECTS_PER_OBJECT );
06663 
06664 
06665       // if it isn't stacked
06666       if ( pComplexObject->ubNumberOfObjects == 1 )
06667       {
06668             // make the main item into the very first subobject
06669             CopyObj( pComplexObject, pNextObj );
06670 
06671             // strip off any loaded ammo/payload
06672             if ( Item [ pComplexObject->usItem ].usItemClass == IC_GUN )
06673             {
06674                   // Exception: don't do this with rocket launchers, their "shots left" are fake and this screws 'em up!
06675                   if ( !Item[pComplexObject->usItem].singleshotrocketlauncher ) // Madd rpg - still do this
06676                   {
06677                         pNextObj->ubGunShotsLeft = 0;
06678                         pNextObj->usGunAmmoItem = NONE;
06679                   }
06680 
06681 /* gunAmmoStatus is currently not being used that way, it's strictly used as a jammed/unjammed, and so should never be 0
06682                   // if jammed, must remember that, so leave it
06683                   if ( pNextObj->bGunAmmoStatus > 0 )
06684                   {
06685                         pNextObj->bGunAmmoStatus = 0;
06686                   }
06687 */
06688             }
06689 
06690 /* ARM: Can now repair with removeable attachments still attached...
06691             // strip off any seperable attachments
06692             for( ubCnt = 0; ubCnt < MAX_ATTACHMENTS; ubCnt++ )
06693             {
06694                   if ( pComplexObject->usAttachItem[ ubCnt ] != NONE )
06695                   {
06696                         // If the attachment is detachable
06697                         if (! (Item[ pComplexObject->usAttachItem[ ubCnt ] ].fFlags & ITEM_INSEPARABLE ) )
06698                         {
06699                               pNextObj->usAttachItem[ ubCnt ] = NONE;
06700                               pNextObj->bAttachStatus[ ubCnt ] = 0;
06701                         }
06702                   }
06703             }
06704 */
06705 
06706             // advance to next available subobject
06707             pNextObj = &gSubObject[ ++ubNextFreeSlot ];
06708 
06709 
06710             // if it's a gun
06711             if ( Item [ pComplexObject->usItem ].usItemClass == IC_GUN )
06712             {
06713                   // and it has ammo/payload
06714                   if ( pComplexObject->usGunAmmoItem != NONE )
06715                   {
06716                         // if it's bullets
06717                         if ( Item[ pComplexObject->usGunAmmoItem ].usItemClass == IC_AMMO )
06718                         {
06719                               // and there are some left
06720                               if ( pComplexObject->ubGunShotsLeft > 0 )
06721                               {
06722                                     // make the bullets into another subobject
06723                                     CreateItem( pComplexObject->usGunAmmoItem, 100, pNextObj );
06724                                     // set how many are left
06725                                     pNextObj->bStatus[ 0 ] = pComplexObject->ubGunShotsLeft;
06726 
06727                                     pNextObj = &gSubObject[ ++ubNextFreeSlot ];
06728                               }
06729                               // ignore this if it's out of bullets
06730                         }
06731                         else  // non-ammo payload
06732                         {
06733                               // make the payload into another subobject
06734                               CreateItem( pComplexObject->usGunAmmoItem, pComplexObject->bGunAmmoStatus, pNextObj );
06735 
06736                               // if the gun was jammed, fix up the payload's status
06737                               if ( pNextObj->bStatus[ 0 ] < 0 )
06738                               {
06739                                     pNextObj->bStatus[ 0 ] *= -1;
06740                               }
06741 
06742                               pNextObj = &gSubObject[ ++ubNextFreeSlot ];
06743                         }
06744                   }
06745             }
06746 
06747 
06748 /* ARM: Can now repair with removeable attachments still attached...
06749             // make each detachable attachment into a separate subobject
06750             for( ubCnt = 0; ubCnt < MAX_ATTACHMENTS; ubCnt++ )
06751             {
06752                   if ( pComplexObject->usAttachItem[ ubCnt ] != NONE )
06753                   {
06754                         // If the attachment is detachable
06755                         if (! (Item[ pComplexObject->usAttachItem[ ubCnt ] ].fFlags & ITEM_INSEPARABLE ) )
06756                         {
06757                               CreateItem( pComplexObject->usAttachItem[ ubCnt ], pComplexObject->bAttachStatus[ ubCnt ], pNextObj );
06758 
06759                               pNextObj = &gSubObject[ ++ubNextFreeSlot ];
06760                         }
06761                   }
06762             }
06763 */
06764       }
06765       else  // stacked
06766       {
06767             // these can't be guns, can't have any attachments, can't be imprinted, etc.
06768             Assert ( Item [ pComplexObject->usItem ].usItemClass != IC_GUN );
06769 
06770             for( ubCnt = 0; ubCnt < MAX_ATTACHMENTS; ubCnt++ )
06771             {
06772                   Assert( pComplexObject->usAttachItem[ ubCnt ] == NONE );
06773             }
06774 
06775             // make each item in the stack into a separate subobject
06776             for( ubCnt = 0; ubCnt < pComplexObject->ubNumberOfObjects; ubCnt++ )
06777             {
06778                   CreateItem( pComplexObject->usItem, pComplexObject->bStatus[ ubCnt ], pNextObj );
06779 
06780                   // advance to next available subobject
06781                   pNextObj = &gSubObject[ ++ubNextFreeSlot ];
06782             }
06783       }
06784 
06785       // make sure we didn't screw up and honk something!
06786       Assert( ubNextFreeSlot <= MAX_SUBOBJECTS_PER_OBJECT );
06787 }
06788 
06789 
06790 void CountSubObjectsInObject( OBJECTTYPE *pComplexObject, UINT8 *pubTotalSubObjects, UINT8 *pubRepairableSubObjects, UINT8 *pubNonRepairableSubObjects )
06791 {
06792       UINT8 ubSubObject;
06793 
06794       *pubTotalSubObjects                             = 0;
06795       *pubRepairableSubObjects            = 0;
06796       *pubNonRepairableSubObjects = 0;
06797 
06798       // check every subobject and count it as either repairable or non-
06799       for ( ubSubObject = 0; ubSubObject < MAX_SUBOBJECTS_PER_OBJECT; ubSubObject++ )
06800       {
06801             // if there is something stored there
06802             if ( gSubObject[ ubSubObject ].usItem != NONE )
06803             {
06804                   ( *pubTotalSubObjects )++;
06805 
06806                   // is it in need of fixing, and also repairable by this dealer?
06807                   // A jammed gun with a 100% status is NOT repairable - shouldn't ever happen
06808                   if ( ( gSubObject[ ubSubObject ].bStatus[ 0 ] != 100 ) &&
06809                                CanDealerRepairItem( gbSelectedArmsDealerID, gSubObject[ ubSubObject ].usItem ) )
06810 
06811                   {
06812                         ( *pubRepairableSubObjects )++;
06813                   }
06814                   else
06815                   {
06816                         ( *pubNonRepairableSubObjects )++;
06817                   }
06818             }
06819       }
06820 }
06821 
06822 
06823 BOOLEAN AddObjectForEvaluation(OBJECTTYPE *pObject, UINT8 ubOwnerProfileId, INT8 bOwnerSlotId, BOOLEAN fFirstOne )
06824 {
06825       INVENTORY_IN_SLOT InvSlot;
06826       INT8  bAddedToSlotID;
06827 
06828       // Make a new inv slot out of the subobject
06829       memset( &InvSlot, 0, sizeof( INVENTORY_IN_SLOT ) );
06830       memcpy( &InvSlot.ItemObject, pObject, sizeof( OBJECTTYPE ) );
06831 
06832       InvSlot.sItemIndex = pObject->usItem;
06833       InvSlot.ubLocationOfObject = PLAYERS_INVENTORY;
06834       InvSlot.ubIdOfMercWhoOwnsTheItem = ubOwnerProfileId;
06835 
06836       //Add the item to the Players Offer Area
06837       bAddedToSlotID = AddItemToPlayersOfferArea( ubOwnerProfileId, &InvSlot, bOwnerSlotId );
06838 
06839       //Do the evaluation for the item if it was added correctly
06840       if( bAddedToSlotID != -1 )
06841       {
06842             // This will move any repairable (sub)objects into the dealer's offer area immediately
06843             EvaluateItemAddedToPlayersOfferArea( bAddedToSlotID, fFirstOne );
06844             return( TRUE );
06845       }
06846       else
06847       {
06848             return( FALSE );
06849       }
06850 }
06851 
06852 
06853 
06854 // The Shopkeeper interface *MUST* use this intermediary function instead of calling AutoPlaceObject() directly!
06855 // This is because the OBJECTTYPEs used within Shopkeeper may contain an illegal ubNumberOfObjects
06856 BOOLEAN ShopkeeperAutoPlaceObject( SOLDIERTYPE * pSoldier, OBJECTTYPE * pObject, BOOLEAN fNewItem )
06857 {
06858       OBJECTTYPE CopyOfObject;
06859       UINT8 ubObjectsLeftToPlace;
06860 
06861       // the entire pObj will get memset to 0 by RemoveObjs() if all the items are successfully placed,
06862       // so we have to keep a copy to retrieve with every iteration of the loop
06863       memcpy( &CopyOfObject, pObject, sizeof( OBJECTTYPE ) );
06864 
06865 
06866       ubObjectsLeftToPlace = pObject->ubNumberOfObjects;
06867 
06868       while ( ubObjectsLeftToPlace > 0 )
06869       {
06870             // figure out how many to place during this loop iteration.  Can't do more than MAX_OBJECTS_PER_SLOT at a time
06871             pObject->ubNumberOfObjects = min( MAX_OBJECTS_PER_SLOT, ubObjectsLeftToPlace);
06872             ubObjectsLeftToPlace -= pObject->ubNumberOfObjects;
06873 
06874             if (!AutoPlaceObject( pSoldier, pObject, fNewItem ))
06875             {
06876                   // no more room, didn't all fit - add back in any that we didn't even get to yet
06877                   pObject->ubNumberOfObjects += ubObjectsLeftToPlace;
06878                   return( FALSE );
06879             }
06880 
06881             // restore object properties from our backup copy
06882             memcpy( pObject, &CopyOfObject, sizeof( OBJECTTYPE ) );
06883       }
06884 
06885       return( TRUE );
06886 }
06887 
06888 
06889 
06890 // The Shopkeeper interface *MUST* use this intermediary function instead of calling AddItemToPool() directly!
06891 // This is because the OBJECTTYPEs used within Shopkeeper may contain an illegal ubNumberOfObjects
06892 void ShopkeeperAddItemToPool( INT16 sGridNo, OBJECTTYPE *pObject, INT8 bVisible, UINT8 ubLevel, UINT16 usFlags, INT8 bRenderZHeightAboveLevel )
06893 {
06894       OBJECTTYPE CopyOfObject;
06895       UINT8 ubObjectsLeftToPlace;
06896 
06897       // the entire pObj will get memset to 0 by RemoveObjs() if all the items are successfully placed,
06898       // so we have to keep a copy to retrieve with every iteration of the loop
06899       memcpy( &CopyOfObject, pObject, sizeof( OBJECTTYPE ) );
06900 
06901       ubObjectsLeftToPlace = pObject->ubNumberOfObjects;
06902 
06903       while ( ubObjectsLeftToPlace > 0 )
06904       {
06905             // figure out how many to place during this loop iteration.  Can't do more than MAX_OBJECTS_PER_SLOT at a time
06906             pObject->ubNumberOfObjects = min( MAX_OBJECTS_PER_SLOT, ubObjectsLeftToPlace);
06907             ubObjectsLeftToPlace -= pObject->ubNumberOfObjects;
06908 
06909             AddItemToPool( sGridNo, pObject, bVisible, ubLevel, usFlags, bRenderZHeightAboveLevel );
06910 
06911             // restore object properties from our backup copy
06912             memcpy( pObject, &CopyOfObject, sizeof( OBJECTTYPE ) );
06913       }
06914 }
06915 
06916 
06917 
06918 void IfMercOwnedCopyItemToMercInv( INVENTORY_IN_SLOT *pInv )
06919 {
06920       INT16 sSoldierID;
06921 
06922       //if the item picked up was in a previous location, and that location is on a merc's inventory
06923       if ( ( pInv->bSlotIdInOtherLocation != -1 ) && ( pInv->ubIdOfMercWhoOwnsTheItem != NO_PROFILE ) )
06924       {
06925             // then it better be a valid slot #
06926             Assert( pInv->bSlotIdInOtherLocation < NUM_INV_SLOTS );
06927             // and it better have a valid merc who owned it
06928             Assert( pInv->ubIdOfMercWhoOwnsTheItem != NO_PROFILE );
06929 
06930             // get soldier
06931             sSoldierID = GetSoldierIDFromMercID( pInv->ubIdOfMercWhoOwnsTheItem );
06932             Assert( sSoldierID != -1 );
06933             Assert( CanMercInteractWithSelectedShopkeeper( MercPtrs[ sSoldierID ] ) );
06934 
06935             //Copy the object back into that merc's original inventory slot
06936             CopyObj( &( pInv->ItemObject ), &( Menptr[ sSoldierID ].inv[ pInv->bSlotIdInOtherLocation ] ) );
06937       }
06938 }
06939 
06940 
06941 void IfMercOwnedRemoveItemFromMercInv( INVENTORY_IN_SLOT *pInv )
06942 {
06943       IfMercOwnedRemoveItemFromMercInv2( pInv->ubIdOfMercWhoOwnsTheItem, pInv->bSlotIdInOtherLocation );
06944 }
06945 
06946 
06947 void IfMercOwnedRemoveItemFromMercInv2( UINT8 ubOwnerProfileId, INT8 bOwnerSlotId )
06948 {
06949       INT16 sSoldierID;
06950       BOOLEAN fSuccess;
06951       OBJECTTYPE ObjectToRemove;
06952 
06953       //if this item was in a previous location, and that location is on a merc's inventory
06954       if ( ( bOwnerSlotId != -1 ) && ( ubOwnerProfileId != NO_PROFILE ) )
06955       {
06956             // then it better be a valid slot #
06957             Assert( bOwnerSlotId < NUM_INV_SLOTS );
06958             // and it better have a valid merc who owned it
06959             Assert( ubOwnerProfileId != NO_PROFILE );
06960 
06961             sSoldierID = GetSoldierIDFromMercID( ubOwnerProfileId );
06962             Assert( sSoldierID != -1 );
06963             Assert( CanMercInteractWithSelectedShopkeeper( MercPtrs[ sSoldierID ] ) );
06964 
06965             //remove the object from that merc's original inventory slot
06966             fSuccess = RemoveObjectFromSlot( &Menptr[ sSoldierID ], bOwnerSlotId, &ObjectToRemove );
06967             Assert(fSuccess);
06968       }
06969 }
06970 
06971 
06972 
06973 BOOLEAN SKITryToReturnInvToOwnerOrCurrentMerc( INVENTORY_IN_SLOT *pInv )
06974 {
06975       // don't use this if the item has a copy in merc's inventory!!  It would create a duplicate!!
06976       Assert( pInv->bSlotIdInOtherLocation == -1 );
06977 
06978       // if it does have an owner
06979       if( pInv->ubIdOfMercWhoOwnsTheItem != NO_PROFILE )
06980       {
06981             INT16 sSoldierID;
06982 
06983             sSoldierID = GetSoldierIDFromMercID( pInv->ubIdOfMercWhoOwnsTheItem );
06984             // if that soldier is not in player's hire any longer
06985             if ( sSoldierID == -1 )
06986             {
06987                   return(FALSE);
06988             }
06989 
06990             // For owners of repaired items, this checks that owner is still hired, in sector,
06991             // on current squad, close enough to the shopkeeper, etc.
06992             if ( !CanMercInteractWithSelectedShopkeeper( MercPtrs[ sSoldierID ] ) )
06993             {
06994                   return(FALSE);
06995             }
06996 
06997             // Try to find a place to put in its owner's inventory (regardless of which merc is currently displayed!)
06998             if ( SKITryToAddInvToMercsInventory( pInv, MercPtrs[ sSoldierID ] ) )
06999             {
07000                   return( TRUE );
07001             }
07002 
07003             // owner's inventory is full, so we'll try to give it to the current merc instead
07004       }
07005 
07006 
07007       //if the current merc is not disabled
07008       if( !gfSMDisableForItems )
07009       {
07010             // Try to find a place to put in current merc's inventory
07011             if ( SKITryToAddInvToMercsInventory( pInv, gpSMCurrentMerc ) )
07012             {
07013                   return( TRUE );
07014             }
07015       }
07016 
07017       //failed to add item, either inventory was filled up, or nobody was even eligible to receive it
07018       return( FALSE );
07019 }
07020 
07021 
07022 BOOLEAN SKITryToAddInvToMercsInventory( INVENTORY_IN_SLOT *pInv, SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier )
07023 {
07024       INT8  bMoneyInvPos;
07025       BOOLEAN fNewItem = FALSE;
07026 
07027 
07028       //if the item is money
07029       if( Item[ pInv->sItemIndex ].usItemClass == IC_MONEY )
07030       {
07031             // search through the merc's inventory for a pocket of money which isn't full already
07032             bMoneyInvPos = GetInvSlotOfUnfullMoneyInMercInventory( pSoldier );
07033 
07034             // if he has a money pocket going
07035             if ( bMoneyInvPos != -1 )
07036             {
07037                   // try to add to it.  If successful, it will delete the object...  It returns TRUE even if not all would fit!
07038                   PlaceObject( pSoldier, bMoneyInvPos, &( pInv->ItemObject ) );
07039 
07040                   // if the money is all gone
07041                   if ( pInv->ItemObject.uiMoneyAmount == 0 )
07042                   {
07043                         // we've been succesful!
07044                         return(TRUE);
07045                   }
07046                   // otherwise we'll try to place the rest seperately
07047             }
07048       }
07049 
07050 
07051   // If it's just been purchased or repaired, mark it as a "new item"
07052       fNewItem = ( BOOLEAN ) ( pInv->uiFlags & ( ARMS_INV_JUST_PURCHASED | ARMS_INV_ITEM_REPAIRED ) );
07053 
07054       //try autoplacing the item in this soldier's inventory.
07055       if( !ShopkeeperAutoPlaceObject( pSoldier, &pInv->ItemObject, fNewItem ) )
07056       {
07057             //failed to add item, inventory probably filled up
07058             return( FALSE );
07059       }
07060 
07061       return(TRUE);
07062 }
07063 
07064 
07065 
07066 BOOLEAN CanMercInteractWithSelectedShopkeeper( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier )
07067 {
07068       SOLDIERTYPE *pShopkeeper;
07069       INT16             sDestGridNo;
07070       INT8              bDestLevel;
07071       INT16             sDistVisible;
07072       UINT32            uiRange;
07073 
07074 
07075       Assert( pSoldier!= NULL );
07076       Assert( gbSelectedArmsDealerID != -1 );
07077 
07078       pShopkeeper = FindSoldierByProfileID( ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubShopKeeperID, FALSE );
07079       Assert( pShopkeeper != NULL );
07080       Assert( pShopkeeper->bActive );
07081       Assert( pShopkeeper->bInSector );
07082 
07083       if ( pShopkeeper->bLife < OKLIFE )
07084       {
07085             return( FALSE );
07086       }
07087 
07088       if ( pSoldier->bActive && pSoldier->bInSector && IsMercOnCurrentSquad( pSoldier ) && ( pSoldier->bLife >= OKLIFE ) &&
07089             !( pSoldier->uiStatusFlags & SOLDIER_VEHICLE ) && !AM_A_ROBOT( pSoldier ) )
07090       {
07091             sDestGridNo = pShopkeeper->sGridNo;
07092             bDestLevel  = pShopkeeper->bLevel;
07093 
07094             // is he close enough to see that gridno if he turns his head?
07095             sDistVisible = DistanceVisible( pSoldier, DIRECTION_IRRELEVANT, DIRECTION_IRRELEVANT, sDestGridNo, bDestLevel, pSoldier );
07096 
07097             // If he has LOS...
07098             if ( SoldierTo3DLocationLineOfSightTest( pSoldier, sDestGridNo, bDestLevel, 3, (UINT8) sDistVisible, TRUE ) )
07099             {
07100                   // Get range to shopkeeper
07101                   uiRange = GetRangeFromGridNoDiff( pSoldier->sGridNo, sDestGridNo );
07102 
07103                   // and is close enough to talk to the shopkeeper (use this define INSTEAD of PASSING_ITEM_DISTANCE_OKLIFE!)
07104                   if ( uiRange <= NPC_TALK_RADIUS )
07105                   {
07106                         return( TRUE );
07107                   }
07108             }
07109       }
07110 
07111       return( FALSE );
07112 }
07113 
07114 
07115 
07116 #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
07117 
07118 void AddShopkeeperToGridNo( UINT8 ubProfile, INT16 sGridNo )
07119 {
07120       SOLDIERCREATE_STRUCT          MercCreateStruct;
07121       INT16                                                       sSectorX, sSectorY;
07122       UINT8                                                 ubID;
07123 
07124       GetCurrentWorldSector( &sSectorX, &sSectorY );
07125 
07126       memset( &MercCreateStruct, 0, sizeof( MercCreateStruct ) );
07127       MercCreateStruct.bTeam                    = CIV_TEAM;
07128       MercCreateStruct.ubProfile          = ubProfile;
07129       MercCreateStruct.sSectorX                 = sSectorX;
07130       MercCreateStruct.sSectorY                 = sSectorY;
07131       MercCreateStruct.bSectorZ                 = gbWorldSectorZ;
07132       MercCreateStruct.sInsertionGridNo         = sGridNo;
07133 
07134       if ( TacticalCreateSoldier( &MercCreateStruct, &ubID ) )
07135       {
07136             AddSoldierToSector( ubID );
07137 
07138             // So we can see them!
07139             AllTeamsLookForAll(NO_INTERRUPTS);
07140       }
07141 }
07142 
07143 #endif
07144 
07145 
07146 void ExitSKIRequested()
07147 {
07148       BOOLEAN     fPlayerOwnedStuffOnTable = FALSE;
07149 
07150 
07151       ShutUpShopKeeper();
07152 
07153       if( !gfRemindedPlayerToPickUpHisStuff )
07154       {
07155             if( AreThereItemsInThePlayersOfferArea( ) )
07156             {
07157                   fPlayerOwnedStuffOnTable = TRUE;
07158             }
07159 
07160             if( ( ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubTypeOfArmsDealer == ARMS_DEALER_REPAIRS ) &&
07161                         AreThereItemsInTheArmsDealersOfferArea( ) )
07162             {
07163                   fPlayerOwnedStuffOnTable = TRUE;
07164             }
07165 
07166             //if there are any items belonging to player still on the table
07167             if( fPlayerOwnedStuffOnTable )
07168             {
07169                   // remind player to pick them up
07170                   ShutUpShopKeeper( );
07171                   StartShopKeeperTalking( SK_QUOTES_PRESSED_DONE_STILL_HAS_STUFF_IN_OFFER_AREA );
07172                   gfRemindedPlayerToPickUpHisStuff = TRUE;
07173                   return;
07174             }
07175             else
07176             {
07177                   //if the player has already requested to leave
07178                   if( gfUserHasRequestedToLeave )
07179                   {
07180                         // has already asked to leave, shut the dealer up and allow the player to leave
07181                         ShutUpShopKeeper();
07182                         return;
07183                   }
07184             }
07185       }
07186 
07187 
07188       // if the player hasn't already requested to leave
07189       if( !gfUserHasRequestedToLeave )
07190       {
07191             UINT16 usQuoteNum;
07192 
07193             if( gfDoneBusinessThisSession )
07194                   usQuoteNum = SK_QUOTES_PRESSES_DONE_HAS_AT_LEAST_1_TRANSACTION;
07195             else
07196                   usQuoteNum = SK_QUOTES_PRESSED_DONE_HASNT_MADE_TRANSACTION;
07197 
07198             StartShopKeeperTalking( usQuoteNum );
07199 
07200             //Set the fact that the player wants to leave
07201             gfUserHasRequestedToLeave = TRUE;
07202       }
07203 }
07204 
07205 
07206 
07207 void ResetAllQuoteSaidFlags()
07208 {
07209       UINT8 uiCnt;
07210 
07211       // reset flags for quotes said
07212       for ( uiCnt = 0; uiCnt < NUM_EVAL_RESULTS; uiCnt++ )
07213       {
07214             gfEvalResultQuoteSaid[ uiCnt ] = FALSE;
07215       }
07216 
07217       guiLastTimeDealerSaidNormalEvaluationQuote = 0;
07218 }
07219 
07220 
07221 
07222 void DealWithItemsStillOnTheTable()
07223 {
07224       BOOLEAN fAddedCorrectly = FALSE;
07225       UINT8 ubCnt;
07226       SOLDIERTYPE *pDropSoldier;
07227 
07228 
07229       // in case we have have to drop stuff off at someone's feet, figure out where it's all gonna go
07230 
07231       // use the current merc, unless he's ineligible, then use the selected merc instead.
07232       if( !gfSMDisableForItems )
07233       {
07234             pDropSoldier = gpSMCurrentMerc;
07235       }
07236       else
07237       {
07238             pDropSoldier = MercPtrs[ gusSelectedSoldier ];
07239       }
07240 
07241       // this guy HAS to be valid!
07242       Assert( CanMercInteractWithSelectedShopkeeper( pDropSoldier ) );
07243 
07244 
07245       //loop through the players offer area and add return any items there to the player
07246       for( ubCnt=0; ubCnt<SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS; ubCnt++)
07247       {
07248             //if there is an item here, give it back somehow
07249             if( PlayersOfferArea[ ubCnt ].fActive )
07250             {
07251                   ReturnItemToPlayerSomehow( &( PlayersOfferArea[ ubCnt ] ), pDropSoldier );
07252                   ClearPlayersOfferSlot( ubCnt );
07253             }
07254       }
07255 
07256 
07257       //if the dealer repairs
07258       if( ArmsDealerInfo[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].ubTypeOfArmsDealer == ARMS_DEALER_REPAIRS )
07259       {
07260             //loop through the arms dealers' offer area and return any items there to the player
07261             for( ubCnt = 0; ubCnt < SKI_NUM_TRADING_INV_SLOTS; ubCnt++)
07262             {
07263             //if there is an item here, give it back somehow
07264                   if( ArmsDealerOfferArea[ ubCnt ].fActive )
07265                   {
07266                         ReturnItemToPlayerSomehow( &( ArmsDealerOfferArea[ ubCnt ] ), pDropSoldier );
07267                         ClearArmsDealerOfferSlot( ubCnt );
07268                   }
07269             }
07270       }
07271 }
07272 
07273 
07274 
07275 void ReturnItemToPlayerSomehow( INVENTORY_IN_SLOT *pInvSlot, SOLDIERTYPE *pDropSoldier )
07276 {
07277       //if the item doesn't have a duplicate copy in its owner merc's inventory slot
07278       if( pInvSlot->bSlotIdInOtherLocation == -1 )
07279       {
07280             // first try to give it to its owner, or if he's unavailable, the current merc
07281             if ( !SKITryToReturnInvToOwnerOrCurrentMerc( pInvSlot ) )
07282             {
07283                   // failed to add item, inventory probably filled up or item is unowned and current merc ineligible.
07284                   // drop it at the specified guy's feet instead
07285                   ShopkeeperAddItemToPool( pDropSoldier->sGridNo, &pInvSlot->ItemObject, VISIBLE, pDropSoldier->bLevel, 0, 0 );
07286             }
07287       }
07288 }
07289 
07290 
07291 
07292 void GivePlayerSomeChange( UINT32 uiAmount )
07293 {
07294       INVENTORY_IN_SLOT MoneyInvSlot;
07295 
07296       memset( &MoneyInvSlot, 0, sizeof ( MoneyInvSlot ) );
07297 
07298       CreateMoney( uiAmount, &MoneyInvSlot.ItemObject );
07299       MoneyInvSlot.sItemIndex = MoneyInvSlot.ItemObject.usItem;
07300       MoneyInvSlot.ubLocationOfObject = PLAYERS_INVENTORY;
07301       MoneyInvSlot.ubIdOfMercWhoOwnsTheItem = NO_PROFILE;
07302 
07303       AddItemToPlayersOfferArea( NO_PROFILE, &MoneyInvSlot, -1 );
07304 
07305       if ( ( gbSelectedArmsDealerID == ARMS_DEALER_JAKE ) && 
07306              ( gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].uiArmsDealersCash < uiAmount ) )
07307       {
07308             // HACK HACK HACK: We forgot to write/record quote 27 for Jake, so he ALWAYS must have enough money!
07309             gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].uiArmsDealersCash += ( uiAmount - gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].uiArmsDealersCash );
07310       }
07311 
07312       // he must have enough cash left to give change
07313       Assert( gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].uiArmsDealersCash >= uiAmount );
07314       // subtract change from dealer's cash
07315       gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].uiArmsDealersCash -= uiAmount;
07316 }
07317 
07318 
07319 
07320 void DealerGetsBribed( UINT8 ubProfileId, UINT32 uiMoneyAmount )
07321 {
07322       BOOLEAN fBribable = FALSE;
07323       UINT32 uiMinBribe = 0;
07324       UINT16 usFact = 0;
07325 
07326       // this is only for dealers
07327       if (!IsMercADealer( ubProfileId ) )
07328       {
07329             return;
07330       }
07331 
07332       switch ( ubProfileId )
07333       {
07334             case FRANK:
07335                   fBribable = TRUE;
07336                   uiMinBribe = 10;        // This should match the handling of a bribe submitted outside the SKI, using the GIVE system
07337                   usFact = FACT_FRANK_HAS_BEEN_BRIBED;
07338                   break;
07339       }
07340 
07341       // if this guy can be bribed, and we gave enough to bribe him
07342       if ( fBribable && ( uiMoneyAmount >= uiMinBribe ) )
07343       {
07344             // set the appropriate fact
07345             SetFactTrue( usFact );
07346       }
07347 }
07348 
07349 
07350 
07351 void HandlePossibleRepairDelays()
07352 {
07353       UINT32 uiHoursSinceAnyItemsShouldHaveBeenRepaired = 0;
07354 
07355 
07356       // assume there won't be a delay
07357       gfStartWithRepairsDelayedQuote = FALSE;
07358 
07359       // if it's Fredo or Perko
07360       if ( ( gbSelectedArmsDealerID == ARMS_DEALER_FREDO ) || ( gbSelectedArmsDealerID == ARMS_DEALER_PERKO ) )
07361       {
07362             // because the quotes are so specific, we'll only use them once per game per repairman
07363             if( !gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].fRepairDelayBeenUsed )
07364             {
07365                   // and it's been a while since the player last dealt with this repairman (within SKI that is)
07366                   // this serves 2 purposes: 
07367                   // a) reduces delays being much more likely if player checks time remaining very frequently, AND
07368                   // b) gives time for the events described in the text of the dealers' excuses to happen (e.g. scouting trip)
07369                   if ( ( GetWorldTotalMin() - gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].uiTimePlayerLastInSKI ) >= ( 3 * 60 ) )
07370                   {
07371                         // if he should have been finished, but it's only been a few hours since then (not days!)
07372                         if ( RepairmanFixingAnyItemsThatShouldBeDoneNow( &uiHoursSinceAnyItemsShouldHaveBeenRepaired ) &&
07373                                      ( uiHoursSinceAnyItemsShouldHaveBeenRepaired < REPAIR_DELAY_IN_HOURS ) )
07374                         {
07375                               // then there's a fair chance he'll be delayed.  Use pre-chance to hopefully preserve across reloads
07376                               if ( PreChance( 50 ) )
07377                               {
07378                                     DelayRepairsInProgressBy( ( REPAIR_DELAY_IN_HOURS + Random( REPAIR_DELAY_IN_HOURS ) ) * 60 );
07379 
07380                                     // this triggers a different opening quote
07381                                     gfStartWithRepairsDelayedQuote = TRUE;
07382 
07383                                     // set flag so it doesn't happen again
07384                                     gArmsDealerStatus[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ].fRepairDelayBeenUsed = TRUE;
07385                               }
07386                         }
07387                   }
07388             }
07389       }
07390 }
07391 
07392 
07393 
07394 BOOLEAN RepairmanFixingAnyItemsThatShouldBeDoneNow( UINT32 *puiHoursSinceOldestItemRepaired )
07395 {
07396       UINT16 usItemIndex;
07397       UINT8  ubElement;
07398       DEALER_ITEM_HEADER *pDealerItem;
07399       DEALER_SPECIAL_ITEM *pSpecialItem;
07400       BOOLEAN fFoundOne = FALSE;
07401       UINT32 uiMinutesSinceItWasDone;
07402       UINT32 uiMinutesShopClosedSinceItWasDone;
07403       UINT32 uiWorkingHoursSinceThisItemRepaired;
07404 
07405 
07406       //if the dealer is not a repair dealer, return
07407       if( !DoesDealerDoRepairs( gbSelectedArmsDealerID ) )
07408             return( FALSE );
07409 
07410       *puiHoursSinceOldestItemRepaired = 0;
07411 
07412       //loop through the dealers inventory and check if there are only unrepaired items
07413       for( usItemIndex = 1; usItemIndex < MAXITEMS; usItemIndex++ )
07414       {
07415             if ( Item[usItemIndex].usItemClass  == 0 )
07416                   break;
07417 
07418             pDealerItem = &( gArmsDealersInventory[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ][ usItemIndex ] );
07419 
07420             //if there is some items in stock
07421             if( pDealerItem->ubTotalItems )
07422             {
07423                   //loop through the array of items
07424                   for( ubElement=0; ubElement< pDealerItem->ubElementsAlloced; ubElement++ )
07425                   {
07426                         pSpecialItem = &( pDealerItem->SpecialItem[ ubElement ] );
07427 
07428                         if ( pSpecialItem->fActive )
07429                         {
07430                               //if the items status is below 0, the item is being repaired
07431                               if( pSpecialItem->Info.bItemCondition < 0 )
07432                               {
07433                                     //if the repairs are done
07434                                     if( pSpecialItem->uiRepairDoneTime <= GetWorldTotalMin() )
07435                                     {
07436                                           // at least one item is supposed to be done by now
07437                                           fFoundOne = TRUE;
07438 
07439                                           uiMinutesSinceItWasDone = GetWorldTotalMin() - pSpecialItem->uiRepairDoneTime;
07440                                           uiMinutesShopClosedSinceItWasDone = CalculateMinutesClosedBetween( gbSelectedArmsDealerID, pSpecialItem->uiRepairDoneTime, GetWorldTotalMin() );
07441 
07442                                           // calculate how many WORKING hours since this item's been repaired
07443                                           uiWorkingHoursSinceThisItemRepaired = ( uiMinutesSinceItWasDone - uiMinutesShopClosedSinceItWasDone ) / 60;
07444 
07445                                           // we need to determine how long it's been since the item that's been repaired for the longest time was done
07446                                           if ( uiWorkingHoursSinceThisItemRepaired > *puiHoursSinceOldestItemRepaired )
07447                                           {
07448                                                 *puiHoursSinceOldestItemRepaired = uiWorkingHoursSinceThisItemRepaired;
07449                                           }
07450                                     }
07451                               }
07452                         }
07453                   }
07454             }
07455       }
07456 
07457 
07458       // if FALSE returned here, he's either not repairing anything, or none of it's done yet
07459       return( fFoundOne );
07460 }
07461 
07462 
07463 void DelayRepairsInProgressBy( UINT32 uiMinutesDelayed )
07464 {
07465       UINT16 usItemIndex;
07466       UINT8  ubElement;
07467       DEALER_ITEM_HEADER *pDealerItem;
07468       DEALER_SPECIAL_ITEM *pSpecialItem;
07469       UINT32 uiMinutesShopClosedBeforeItsDone;
07470 
07471 
07472       //if the dealer is not a repair dealer, return
07473       if( !DoesDealerDoRepairs( gbSelectedArmsDealerID ) )
07474             return;
07475 
07476       //loop through the dealers inventory and check if there are only unrepaired items
07477       for( usItemIndex = 1; usItemIndex < MAXITEMS; usItemIndex++ )
07478       {
07479             if ( Item[usItemIndex].usItemClass  == 0 )
07480                   return;
07481 
07482             pDealerItem = &( gArmsDealersInventory[ gbSelectedArmsDealerID ][ usItemIndex ] );
07483 
07484             //if there is some items in stock
07485             if( pDealerItem->ubTotalItems )
07486             {
07487                   //loop through the array of items
07488                   for( ubElement=0; ubElement< pDealerItem->ubElementsAlloced; ubElement++ )
07489                   {
07490                         pSpecialItem = &( pDealerItem->SpecialItem[ ubElement ] );
07491 
07492                         if ( pSpecialItem->fActive )
07493                         {
07494                               //if the items status is below 0, the item is being repaired
07495                               if( pSpecialItem->Info.bItemCondition < 0 )
07496                               {
07497                                     uiMinutesShopClosedBeforeItsDone = CalculateOvernightRepairDelay( gbSelectedArmsDealerID, pSpecialItem->uiRepairDoneTime, uiMinutesDelayed );
07498 
07499                                     // add this many minutes to the repair time estimate
07500                                     pSpecialItem->uiRepairDoneTime += ( uiMinutesShopClosedBeforeItsDone + uiMinutesDelayed );
07501                               }
07502                         }
07503                   }
07504             }
07505       }
07506 }
07507 
07508 
07509 
07510 //Mouse Call back for the Arms delaers face
07511 void SelectArmsDealersDropItemToGroundRegionCallBack(MOUSE_REGION * pRegion, INT32 iReason )
07512 {
07513       // WANNE 2: not needed to drop the item to the ground -> on the right side of the shopkeeper screen!
07514       /*
07515       if (iReason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_INIT)
07516       {
07517       }
07518       else if(iReason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP)
07519       {
07520             SOLDIERTYPE *pDropSoldier;
07521 
07522             // use the current merc, unless he's ineligible, then use the selected merc instead.
07523             if( !gfSMDisableForItems )
07524             {
07525                   pDropSoldier = gpSMCurrentMerc;
07526             }
07527             else
07528             {
07529                   pDropSoldier = MercPtrs[ gusSelectedSoldier ];
07530             }
07531 
07532             //if we don't have an item, pick one up
07533             if( gMoveingItem.sItemIndex != 0 )
07534             {
07535                   
07536                   //add the item to the ground
07537                   ShopkeeperAddItemToPool( pDropSoldier->sGridNo, &gMoveingItem.ItemObject, VISIBLE, pDropSoldier->bLevel, 0, 0 );
07538 
07539                   //Reset the cursor
07540                   SetSkiCursor( CURSOR_NORMAL );
07541 
07542                   //refresh the screen
07543                   gubSkiDirtyLevel = SKI_DIRTY_LEVEL2;
07544             }
07545       }
07546       */
07547 }
07548 
07549 void SelectArmsDealersDropItemToGroundMovementRegionCallBack(MOUSE_REGION * pRegion, INT32 iReason )
07550 { 
07551       if( iReason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LOST_MOUSE )
07552       {
07553             gfSkiDisplayDropItemToGroundText = FALSE;
07554             gubSkiDirtyLevel = SKI_DIRTY_LEVEL2;
07555       }
07556       else if( iReason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_GAIN_MOUSE )
07557       {
07558             if( CanTheDropItemToGroundStringBeDisplayed() )
07559             {
07560                   gfSkiDisplayDropItemToGroundText = TRUE;
07561             }
07562             else
07563             {
07564                   gubSkiDirtyLevel = SKI_DIRTY_LEVEL2;
07565                   gfSkiDisplayDropItemToGroundText = FALSE;
07566             }
07567       }
07568       else if( iReason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_MOVE )
07569       {
07570       }
07571 }
07572 
07573 
07574 BOOLEAN     CanTheDropItemToGroundStringBeDisplayed()
07575 {
